place.name: CHILLINGTON
place.gazetteerText: CHILLINGTON, a parish in Chard district, Somerset; 3 miles SE of Ilmiuster, and 3 WNW of Crewkerne r. station. Post town, Ilminster. Acres, 881. Real property, £1, 603. Pop., 298. Houses, 56. The property is divided among a few. The living is a vicarage in the diocese of Bath and Wells. Value, £60. Patron, Earl Powlett. The church is good. (In 1870-72, John Marius Wilson's Imperial Gazetteer of England and Wales)
